snippet: The world took notice when Lonesome George died, marking the end of his subspecies. But for researchers and workers in the Galápagos Islands, his death also takes a personal tone.
abstract: George, the last giant tortoise of his subspecies in the Galapagos Islands, is found dead of natural causes in his corral at the Charles Darwin Research Station on Puerto Ayora; his death comes as a shock to his caretakers, who had hoped that George, who was thought to be around 100, would survive for decades to continue his line.
lead_paragraph: The world took notice when Lonesome George died, marking the end of his subspecies. But for researchers and workers in the Galápagos Islands, his death also takes a personal tone.

headline.seo: Death of Lonesome George the Tortoise Gives Extinction a Face
headline.main: A Giant Tortoise’s Death Gives Extinction a Face
headline.print_headline: A Giant Tortoise’s Death Gives Extinction a Face
